meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Lee May Ilissa Gold Sarah Olson Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6745.

td.p: Lee May, a merchandising manager originally from Roanoke, Virginia
Ilissa Gold, an attorney originally from Nashville, Tennessee
Sarah Olson, a project coordinator from El Cerrito, California (whose 1-day cash winnings total $10,600)

tr.td: (Alex: The word "abundance" has 9 letters, and each correct response will be made up of those letters.)
(Kelly: [*], outside Santa Fe, El Rancho de las Golondrinas re-creates life the way it was a century or two or three ago.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'The thinnest coin we use today, it\'s 1.35 mm thick')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: The thinnest coin we use today, it's 1.35 mm thick

toggle('clue_J_5_1', 'clue_J_5_1_stuck', '(Ilissa: What are beans?)

bean

SarahIlissa
')

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Jimmy of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from Santa Fe, New Mexico.) A longtime fixture in New Mexico, the versatile horno, or beehive oven, keeps its temperature for several hours; 1 common use is making chicos, a treat from this staple Indian grain')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from Santa Fe, New Mexico.) A longtime fixture in New Mexico, the versatile horno, or beehive oven, keeps its temperature for several hours; 1 common use is making chicos, a treat from this staple Indian grain

Spain wouldn\'t send fine Merino sheep to north America, so the mainstay of colonial textiles were these sheep, still bred today; the name means "coarse" or "rough", & you may know it from a sweet treat with a rough, ribbed texture')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from Santa Fe, New Mexico.) Spain wouldn't send fine Merino sheep to north America, so the mainstay of colonial textiles were these sheep, still bred today; the name means "coarse" or "rough", & you may know it from a sweet treat with a rough, ribbed texture

$2,801
democracy')
